comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] From your earlier comment: "The wreck happened on 06/05/1898. Report in the SMH 07/05/1898 p.9 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/14132900 . The ship was stuck there for months." Randwick City Council also have a page on their website about HEREWARD and how long it remained on the beach: bit.ly/Orrp7T A long time!
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Cannon retrieved 26/3/2013 ! The sand covering the wreck was washed away recently. southern-courier.whereilive.com.au/photos/gallery/the-her... Watch this space!

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] How fascinating! Great pictures :) I guess Randwick Council will have to update their entry, esp the bit that says previous work has 'removed all trace of the HEREWARD'!
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] This is weird! I saw a short report on Channel 9 NBN News on Tuesday 27/3/13 about retrieving the cannon, but I can't find anything recent on the entire interweb about it. Googled using various combinations of "hereward cannon wreck maroubra " ?? A dive video in 2011 - vimeo.com/25710306

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Here's a lttle info, including that the HEREWARD ship's bell is in the local Primary School - modelshipworld.com/index.php?/topic/1392-hereward-cannon-...

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: And a 'genericitis' Flickr Set of recent wreck photos - [http://www.flickr.com/photos/genericitis/sets/72157633072293917/]

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Cheers BC - lovely clear photos of the wreck. Here is the media release that The Office of Environment and Heritage posted yesterday about the retrieval of the cannon.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] Thank you.  It seems strange trying to find out about stuff happening NOW - I am not used to it!

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Haha yes we understand! It is hard to know where to start looking for modern information when you are used to pre-1955!
